div.p: This example, as well as the next two examples, show how to use Simple XML to create real-time dashboards.

The difference between a real-time search and a historical search is that both the earliest and latest API arguments specify a real-time search using either rt or rt with a time modifier, such as rt-30s.
If both are rt then data continues to fill a chart with search results as long as the page is open. Old data never leaves.

On the other hand, with a search where earliest is rt-30s and latest is rt, the chart shows only the date from the most recent 30 seconds. The basic example in this dashboard provides an example for this last scenario:
div.div:
<chart>
<searchString>* | top sourcetype | fields - percent</searchString>
<title>live events, last 30 seconds, by sourcetype</title>
<earliestTime>rt-30s</earliestTime>
<latestTime>rt</latestTime>
<option name="drilldown">none</option>
<option name="charting.chart">bar</option>
</chart>
